detailsOfAchievement: As the organization was registered in 19971998, but has been cariong out his activities for the last several years in the rural and urban areas of district lucknow, deoria, basti, sant kabir nagar & sitapur. This society was established with a basic in to provide social services two all communities, particularly to the weaker section of women youth and children, so they may become self dependent and stand on their own feet to earn their livelihood. The main aim of the society is two provide technical and vocational training to the women / girls. These activities includes training courses of tailoring, embroidery, knitting fashion designing, secretarial practice computer training courses etc. for women, girls and youth of the poor class, backward and S.C /S.T. in addition to it, society is also organized various awareness camps on pollution, envoirment protection, family planning, aids protection and EDV camps etc. Thus the main objective of the society are welfare of human being, educational & socio economic development of water sections youth ( boys & girls ). Aims & objectives of the society have been details in memorandum of association, which is attached here with it is a full pledged unit & is running its own activities of welfare & development with the help of peoples participation & contribution / donation. The society collaborates with state & centre on area of common concern, while supporting infrastructure development, skill development for self employment, income generating program for women & youth, ( boys & girls ) creating of awareness for national programmes & other development activities. The society is running an awareness programme in the block  khairabad of the district sitapur also the society is trying to run a rural development programme for the people of district sitapur with the financial help of ministry of rural development,govt. of india in which the society will provide safe drinking water in all villages of block khairabad, behta, sidhauli, Rampurmathura. More over the society is willing to provide employment based training to the women / girls of this area, so they may become self  dependent. Over the years the society has been very active in the fields of : a) Rural development with the help of various govt. agencies. b) Women welfare & empowerment activities. c) Rehabilitation of flood affected families. d) Handicapped welfare activities. e) Social forestry. f) Social rehabilitation of S.C. / O.B.Cs g) Stray animal welfare programs. h) Social welfare & awareness for S.C. / S.T. / O.B.C.s i) Rural sanitation programme. j) Water conservation & management programme. k) Safe & clean drinking water. l) Farmer training programmes. m) Health programmes. the society has been well appreciated and recognized by the public and authorities. The following projects have been executed by the society on its own: 1) Educational programme. 2) Litrecy campaign. 3) Health check up camps. 4) Sanitation campaign. 5) Rehabilitation campaign

detailsOfAchievement: Jan Sewa Ashram is an NGO working on Socio- environmental issues. Jan Sewa Ashram was established in the year 1982. Jan Sewa Ashram took into consideration the problem of SWM in town very seriously and designed a package, under which First ever-microbial composting plant of Northern region, was established at Salogara near Solan ,(H.P.) to solve city waste problem by converting it into useful manure through environment friendly technology. Jan Sewa Ashram has been engaged in reestablishing the environment and is manufacturing Hand made paper and paper products since last 15 years. (a) Expertise available with the group:  Waste Paper recycling,  Waste plastic utilization  Environmental Education,  Solid Waste Management,  Vermicomposting (in large scale)  Aromatic oil Extraction,  Bio Coal (non conventional energy),  Training for promoting Micro-enterprise  Marketing of Eco-products,  Promotion of Micro-enterprise based on internal processing of locally available raw material.  Dissemination of Appropriate Technology  Health and sanitation programmes.  Eco-farming through bio-compost.  Integrated rural development  Encouraging appropriate practices for dairy farming.

detailsOfAchievement: The organization has been working for about 19 years for the Child Establishment Programme in 60 village of Akbarpur Block supported by CRY since 1997 to 30 June 2014. There was along with troubled children from brick industries fellowship started in year 1997 and in year 2000 this program changed. And 13 GP along with 60 villages of Akbarpur block and 2 wards of Nagar Panchayat Iltifatganj of Tanda block of the district as primary level started with mainly 4 points as right to living right to development right to security right to participation. CHANGE ENABLED 13092 children enrolled in school 640 children identified with malnutrition 292 children immunized 271 birth registrations provided 53 childrens groups formed 50 new ICDS centers opened WHAT CHANGED A large section of the population in Ambedkar Nagar district is landless. Marginal families have migrated to other cities in search of a livelihood. Dalits are discriminated in society and are forced to live in separate hamlets. To make matters worse there are additional issues of discrimination against orphans and children with special needs pitiful state of government education facilities and a defunct health delivery system. Today, there is a good understanding on the status and issue of children and violation of their rights in the region Jan Shikshan Kendra (JSK) is working in 60 villages in the region since the last 18 years. The organization has been instrumental in mobilizing the community and forming CBOs to address the issues of child rights violation education, health and livelihood. JSK focus areas are - to reduce maternal mortality and infant mortality, regularization of government service delivery mechanism, awareness on birth registration immunization and regular health check-ups reducing malnutrition and strengthening of infrastructure to provide quality education. Empowering Rural Women programme in 40 panchayat Since 1 feb 2010 to 31 Jan 2014 in Jalalpur block supported by SDTT Manrega PDS Gram Sabha Collectivization and strengthen of 6504 of 40 GPs as Savitri bai fule nari sangh. Job demand increased with participation from 30 percent. PDS improved as per standerd distribution made and non opening shops moves as running mode by NS. Participation increased in Gram Sabha by 50 percent. Community Health programme is running in 40 Panchayat Since 1 April 2013 in jallalpur block supported by SJTT By the support of SJTT and in monitoring of PANI there are Health initiative program started in 40 GPs that was issue of NS own. In which NS members want to improve their reproductive and maternal health along with malnourishment of children. This program is covering this aims with Adolescent health, child health, maternal health and environmental health with the hygiene and sanitations. NS made their object VHSNC roles and responsibilities including collectivization and strengthen. NS ensuring VHSNC empowerment and NHM aims.

detailsOfAchievement: The JSS has been active in Banda District for last fifteen years. The major achievement being it has successfully established its credibility and gencunily in the targeted group. Banda has always been a remote and under developed district where the girls specially from our targeted class were not even allowed to come out of home, but to this scheme the girls have lapped up in a big way, ninety percent of our beneficiaries being girls. Now they appear to be more confidence of their needs and capabilities. N.P.E.G.E.L.has been providing skill development training to schools and colleges under Basic Shiksha Parishad. Here clear preference has been given to the candidates trained by JSS Banda to impart the training on the basis of their reputation. An information stall (Centre) was organized at Girwan under Bharat Nirman Jan Suchana programme. Similarly an information stall (Centre) was organized at Govt Inter College Srinagar Mahoba in coordination with P.I.P Kanpur. A certificate to the effect of commendable work and the third Prize and a Shield was given to JSS Banda. In the programme for making Sansad Adarsh Gram Katra Kalinjar 100 percent literate, the JSS Banda and Rajya Sansadhan Kendra LKO organized poppet show, wall painting activities, poster and Board display and contributed to it success at Pipramaaf Mahoba and Katra Kalinjar. The Nav Sakshars were distributed Stationery items by JSS Banda & were duly encouraged under directions of Govt of India. For their commendable contribution Shri, Aslam & Smt. Madhu our Prerak were awarded with Shield & Certificate of Merrit by Rajya Sansadhan Kendra & Vaikalpik Shiksha Nideshalay Lucknow. Ammong our Trainees Mrs. Arti Singh Marka Village was provided with a Loan of Rs. 1 Lac by Khadi Gramodyog Board to establish a Unit. Mrs. Usha Khare was helped in securing similar Loan with our efforts to establish a unit. Both of them are reportedly earning to the tune of Rs. 5000/= a growth & regularly paying back their loan. Mr. Kashi Prasad with our efforts secured a loan of Rs. 50,000/= from Allahabad Bank under Pradhan Manti Mudra rin Yojna be also successfully repaying his loan. JSS organized an activity under Prime Minister Swachhata Pakhwada at Saraswati Balika Vidhya Mandir Inter College Ken Path. Essays & debates were organized on the subject Swachha Bharat, Green Bharat and Environment around 20 Students participated. They were duly awarded and refreshment was arranged.

detailsOfAchievement: Jayati Bharatam is a Non-Government Organization engaged in comprehensive development of Visually Impaired and Physically disabled students since 2005. The organisation identifies needs and develops solutions to improve the lives of these people, through meaningful connections, capacity building and aide. We have currently seventy students from all over India who are receiving integrated schooling facility from our organisation . The organisation is based on philanthropic ideas and for the betterment of disabled. We are running the organisation since last 10 years. We keep a Vision to see people with disabilities empowered and experience life to their best. The organisation identifies needs and develops solutions to improve the lives of these people, through meaningful connections, capacity building and aide.

We have currently eighty students from all over India who are receiving integrated schooling facility from our organisation. We our rigorously working with our students for their betterment and enhance their overall personality development by arranging various trainings for them which would lead them into a better world. We have strengthened and complemented them with free food and accommodation facility since 2011.

We emphasise on their daily activities, provide them with a regular study schedule, arrange educational and personality development trainings, making them aware of the new technologies. Additionally We try and keep the students close to nature by often organising plantation weeks for them and by guiding them with Ayurveda concepts.
